articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets South African Government Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets South African Government Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a friendly talk with the South African government delegation headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.

articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Chad
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Chad
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Djimrangar Dadnadji upon his reappointment as prime minister of Chad.
					 The message wished the prime minister greater success in his responsible work for achieving the economic development of the country.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Moussa Faki Mahamat upon his reappointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and African Integration on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Australian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Australian Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Thursday met and had a talk with William Paterson, new ambassador of the Commonwealth of Australia to the DPRK who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Survey of Construction of Ski Resort
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Survey of Construction of Ski Resort 
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, made field survey of the construction of the Ski Resort on Masik Pass.
					 The construction of the ski resort is near its completion thanks to the devoted efforts of the soldier-builders who are carrying out orders of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un without fail.
					
					 Looking round different places of the construction site, he encouraged the solider-builders to implement the on-the-spot instructions of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called on them to successfully complete the project in the earliest possible period at the speed of a-match-for-a hundred in the 21st century and "Speed on Masik Pass", bearing deep in mind the deep trust reposed by Kim Jong Un in them.
					
					 He stressed the need to simultaneously push ahead with the construction of various structures at a fast speed, greening and land leveling.
					
					 He took measures to satisfactorily ensure the supply of necessary equipment and materials as the construction is progressing at the final phase.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Head of South African Government Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Head of South African Government Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the head of the visiting South African government delegation.
					 Head of the delegation Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, handed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Thursday.

articles.title: S. Korean Spy Arrested in DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Spy Arrested in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Ministry of State Security of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Thursday in connection with an agent of the Intelligence Service of south Korea arrested in the DPRK:
					 A relevant institution recently intercepted an unidentified person in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					
					 At first he insisted that he was Chinese residing in the DPRK and then a citizen of a third country. As investigation progressed, he confessed he is a south Korean who intruded into Pyongyang after illegally entering the DPRK from a third country.
					
					 An initial investigation indicates that he was engaged in anti-DPRK espionage and plot-breeding activities in a third country bordering the DPRK for nearly six years, while disguising himself as a religionist. He entered the DPRK to rally dishonest elements within the boundary of the DPRK and use them for undermining the stability of the social system in the DPRK.
					
					 This fully proves to what extent the puppet group of conservatives has reached in its anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 An institution for state security is now intensifying investigation.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Recognizing Japan's Exercise of "Right to Collective Self-Defense"
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Recognizing Japan's Exercise of "Right to Collective Self-Defense"
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea issued a statement on Thursday condemning the south Korean puppet regime for recently recognizing Japan's exercise of "the right to collective self-defense".
					 Kim Jang Su, chief of the security office of Chongwadae, during his recent visit to the U.S., said that the right to collective self-defense is one of the basic rights of an ordinary state stipulated in the UN Chapter, meaning a tacit support to Japan's exercise of the right.
					
					 Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister of south Korea, uttered at the state inspection of the committee of foreign affairs and unification of the "National Assembly" that some states once recognized Japan's "right to collective self-defense" in accordance with the past San Francisco Treaty, etc. and there was "approach with a great dimension," an undisguised revelation of the intention to allow it.
					
					 The puppet forces are moving to align with Japan in its exercise of the "right to collective self-defense", an unpardonable traitorous act of defending Japan's revival of militarism and paving the way for its overseas aggression. It is also a very dangerous war scheme revealing the attempt at a war of aggression based on the triangular military alliance among the U.S., Japan and south Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Not only Koreans but all other people of the world censure the U.S. recognition of "Japan's exercise of the right to collective self-defense" as "the second Katsura-Taft Treaty".
					
					 It is a dangerous conspiracy for aggression aimed to revive Japan's old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere".
					
					 By siding with Japan's move for the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense", the south Korean puppet forces committed a shameful crime of joining the U.S. and Japan in their scheme for a war of aggression.
					
					 Absolutely intolerable is the traitorous act of the puppet forces unhesitatingly taking part in the war moves against the fellow countrymen while conniving at Japan's thrice-cursed past history of aggression and its moves for grabbing territory.
					
					 The puppet forces are setting preconditions, saying that "agreement" is needed as regards "items related to the sovereignty of the Korean Peninsula" in a bid to cover up their crimes. But it is just a deceptive trick to evade the denunciation of the public at home and abroad.
					
					 Japan's attempt at reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula is becoming a reality and the peace and security of Northeast Asia have been further endangered with the puppet forces' act of colluding with Japan in exercising the "right to collective self-defense".

articles.title: Japanese Guests Leave
articles.content:
Japanese Guests Leave
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan, and his party left here on Thursday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Government Economic Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Vietnamese Government Economic Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The Vietnamese government economic delegation headed by Nguyen Cam Tu, vice-minister of Industry and Commerce, left here for home on Thursday.

articles.title: South African Government Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
South African Government Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The South African government delegation headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Thursday.
					 The members of the delegation visited the old home in Mangyongdae where the President was born and spent his childhood, nurturing his noble intention of revolution. They went round with keen interest historic relics preserved with much care, being briefed on the touching story associated with the historic home.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Mansudae Art Studio, truce village of Panmunjom, Rungna Dophinarium, etc. and enjoyed an acrobatic performance given by the National Circus at the Pyongyang Circus Theater.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun 
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Nippon Sport Science University headed by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami and other foreign personages visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Before the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the visitors paid tribute in humble reverence.
					
					 They entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The guests made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Buddhists in North, South of Korea Hold Joint Mass
articles.content:
Buddhists in North, South of Korea Hold Joint Mass 
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A north-south joint Buddhist mass praying for Korea's reunification and having Nirvana service took place at Ryongthong Temple in Kaesong of the DPRK on Thursday to mark the 8th anniversary of the restoration of the temple and the 912th anniversary of Buddhist priest Uichon's attainment of divine enlightenment. 
					 Present there from the north side were office bearers of the Central Committee of the Buddhist Federation of Korea and priests and Buddhists of the temple and from the south side priests and Buddhists of Chonthae Order.
					
					 A Buddhist ritual was made to be followed by speeches.
					
					 Then a north-south joint Buddhist address praying for national reunification was read out.
					
					 Speakers said that Ryongthong Temple was successfully restored by the efforts of the Buddhists in the north and the south but has failed to play a due role as a seminary for reunification. The distrust and confrontation between the north and the south are escalating, precious successes made in the June 15 era were brought to naught and unpardonable acts persist in south Korea, they added.
					
					 They called upon Buddhists in the north and the south to work hard as the Buddhist saints for reunification to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve the nation's reconciliation and unity.
					
					 A joint address expressed the firm resolution of the Buddhists in the north and the south to unite in Dharma-minded concord and turn out as one in practical actions to defuse the danger of war and achieve durable peace and reunification of the country as indicated by the north-south joint declarations.

articles.title: Sojourn of Japan Sports University Delegation in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Sojourn of Japan Sports University Delegation in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Nippon Sport Science University is now staying here for sports exchanges with Korea University of Physical Education. This is the second time for the Japanese university to send a delegation to the DPRK.
					 There were basketball matches between girl and boy students of the two universities at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Wednesday.
					
					 The men and women' matches ended in 93:74 and 64:51 respectively in favor of Korea University of Physical Education.
					
					 Kenshiro Matsunami, managing director of Nippon Sport Science University, told KCNA he hoped that university students of the two countries would establish friendly relationship and deepen trust with each other through sports exchanges.
					
					 A girl, Yuka Kosge, and a boy, Ryotaro Honma, of the Japanese university, said that they gained good experience in the matches with DPRK players, well prepared in physical and technical terms, at the splendid stadium.
					
					 The delegation consists of 60-odd persons, with 16 men and women cagers and 16 women and 14 men footballers included.
					
					 The first sports exchange between thwo sports universities took place in Pyongyang in November Juche 101 (2012).
					
					 At that time, their students had joint trainings and matches in football, wrestling and Judo events.

articles.title: DPRK Acrobats Win Top Prize at Wuqiao Int'l Acrobatic Festival
articles.content:
DPRK Acrobats Win Top Prize at Wuqiao Int'l Acrobatic Festival
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK acrobats proved successful at the 14th Wuqiao International Acrobatic Festival.
					 The festival held in Hebei Province of China between October 26 and November 3 brought together acrobats from 18 countries including the DPRK, Germany, Russia, Mexico, the U.S., Argentina, Ukraine, France and Cuba.
					
					 The DPRK physical acrobatics "Fly Higher" won the top prize, Gold Lion Prize and its another physical acrobatics "Horizontal Bar and Stunt on Moving Swing" received Silver Lion Prize.
					
					 The members of the organizing committee of the festival and its jury and spectators were unsparing in their praises, congratulating the DPRK acrobats on their successful performance.
					
					 The vice-director of the Cultural Department in Hebei Province said voices praising DPRK acrobatics were heard from all parts of the province, adding this is clear proof that the Sino-DPRK friendship provided by Chairman Mao Zedong and President Kim Il Sung is unbreakable.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Chinese Acrobats Association had this to say: This time DPRK acrobatic pieces received Gold Lion Prize and Silver Lion Prize by bringing the festival to the climax.  Fertile soil is sure to yield good fruits. The fertile soil is leader Kim Jong Il's idea of creating Juche-oriented acrobatics.

articles.title: National Workshop for Development of Organic Agriculture Sector Held
articles.content:
National Workshop for Development of Organic Agriculture Sector Held
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A national workshop for the development of organic agriculture sector co-sponsored by the Pyongyang International Information Center for New Technology and Economy and the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movement (IFOAM), took place at the Pyongyang Center for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries from November 5 to 7.
					 Present there were officials of ministries and national institutions and officials and researchers in the field of science, agricultural experts and members of the delegation of the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movement.
					
					 Opening addresses were made at the workshop.
					
					 Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and director of the Pyongyang International Information Center for New Technology and Economy, said that the workshop served as an important occasion in providing a scientific foundation for the development of organic agriculture.
					
					 He stressed that farming methods suited to the actual conditions of the country are being actively introduced into the field of agriculture of the DPRK under the deep concern of the party and the state.
					
					 Andre Frederick Leu, head of the delegation of the IFOAM, referred to the importance of developing organic agriculture which can ensure a high yield.
					
					 He expressed the belief that close cooperation would be effected during the workshop.
					
					  The workshop involved lectures titled "High yield and food security in organic agriculture," etc.
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 The participants in the workshop exchanged successes and experiences gained in the field of organic agriculture.

articles.title: Horse Riding, One of Koreans' Traditional Customs
articles.content:
Horse Riding, One of Koreans' Traditional Customs
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The Mirim Riding Club was built splendidly in Sadong District of Pyongyang.
					 From the olden times, Koreans have been greatly interested in horse riding and its competitions.
					
					 Horsemanship was remarkably developed in Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					
					 Pictures of horse riding are lively featured in mural paintings of Yaksu-ri and Tokhung-ri tombs, which date back to the kingdom.
					
					 Horse riding was very popular also in the periods of Palhae Dynasty (698-926), the successor to Koguryo, Koryo Dynasty (918-1392) and Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 Koryo instituted it as a law to teach horse riding among youngsters.
					
					 Horse riding was encouraged as a nationwide amusement event in the period of Feudal Joson Dynasty.
					
					 In the period, the Korean people's horsemanship gave a considerable effect on cultural development of other countries, Japan in particular.

articles.title: Koreans' Custom of Making Ball of Soybeans
articles.content:
Koreans' Custom of Making Ball of Soybeans
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- It is one of Koreans' customs to make ball of soybeans, a basic process of preparing soy and bean paste, on the 19th of the 24 seasonal divisions according to the lunar calendar, which falls on November 7 this year.
					 From the olden times the Korean people have regarded soy and bean paste as indispensable foodstuff.
					
					 According to historical archives, those engaged in the project for epitaph of Tokhung-ri tomb in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668) took soy and bean paste during the project. And soy and bean paste was included in the list of ceremonial articles in late Silla period.
					
					 "Jungbosanrimgyongje", a book on agriculture and peasants' life of Korea published in the 18th century, tells about how to make soy and bean paste, praising this soybean sauce as the best foodstuff.
					
					 To produce soy and bean paste, beans should be steeped in water for one night and then boiled and pounded before making a ball of them. This ball, covered with rice straw, is hung up at a kitchen or storehouse for several months.
					
					 The ball undergoes fermentation in next February and March. Then it is put in a jar with salt water.

articles.title: Four Sets of Triplets Born in October in DPRK
articles.content:
Four Sets of Triplets Born in October in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Four sets of triplets were born in the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital in October this year.
					 The first set came from Kim Un Hui living in Kusong City, North Phyongan Province on October 1, the second from Ri Su Yon in Phyongsan County, North Hwanghae Province on October 3, the third from Pak Un Bok in Sinhung County, South Hamgyong Province on October 4 and the fourth from Pak Song Bong in Phyongchon District, Pyongyang on October 17.
					
					 The fourth is the 436th set of triplets born in the hospital.
					
					 The mothers of triplets, taken to the hospital a few months before childbirth, are still put under special medical care.
					
					 They are offered nourishing food and tonics in the hospital.
					
					 They are undergoing after-childbirth treatment benefiting from the most popular healthcare system provided under the loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Kumgang (6)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Kumgang (6)
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- There is a bear-shaped rock on the mid-slope of Junggwanum Peak standing in the Manmulsang (myriad-shaped peaks) Valley of Mt. Kumgang.
					 The rock tells about a legend well known among the local people. 
					
					 Once upon a time, there lived a 100-year-old bear on Piro Peak.
					
					 After the hibernation, the hungry bear had to search for something to eat.
					
					 When it reached the top of Junggwanum Peak, he happened to see acorns scattered in a pond.
					
					 It mistook small pebbles in the lucid water for acorns dropped last autumn.
					
					 The bear, faint with hunger, jumped into the pond to take the feed.
					
					 But, its body was dropped on the mid-slope of the peak with its hind feet caught in a crevice of a rock.
					
					 It could not escape from the rock, only looking down at acorns in the water.
					
					 Years after years, the bear turned into a stone.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redress Crime Related to Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redress Crime Related to Sexual Slavery 
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The sexual slavery committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past has to be settled without fail as it is a hideous crime against humanity unprecedented in history, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The sexual slavery was an organized, state-sponsored crime. It was not made by those women's "own wishes" or their "will" as claimed by the Japanese reactionaries. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries openly deny the coercive nature of the sexual slavery by the Imperial Japanese Army. It is the height of baseness and impertinence peculiar to Japan. 
					
					 The present Japanese authorities claim there are not sufficient facts and evidence to prove the forcible nature of the sexual slavery and that it is an academic matter to be discussed by historians. 
					
					 By denying the forcible nature of the sexual slavery the Japanese reactionaries seek the sinister intention to evade the responsibilities and reparation. It is an unavoidable historical responsibility and legal and moral obligation for Japan to frankly admit the sexual slavery and make an apology and reparation for it. But Japan persistently distorts the truth and resorts to every trick to evade the responsibility and reparation. 
					
					 Now there are many clear traces of Japan's aggression and plunder everywhere and a lot of victims and their descendants remain as eyewitnesses of history. Not only the Koreans but also all other people of the world hardly repress resentment at the behavior of the Japanese authorities distorting the vicious crime of sexual slavery. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should clearly know that Japan will invite stronger denunciation from the international community if they persistently evade the redress of the hideous crime against humanity.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Joining in U.S. MD
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Joining in U.S. MD 
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The chief of the "national security office" of Chongwadae of south Korea said that it would not be fully involved in the U.S. missile defense system during his recent trip to the U.S.
					 Earlier, the south Korean chief executive, the minister of Defense and other heavyweights of the political circle and the military  uttered similar words on various occasions.
					
					 This is nothing but a chicanery of the south Korean regime to fool the international community by covering up its full-scale participation in the U.S. MD.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are now zealously joining in the U.S. MD while talking about what they called independent "south Korean-style MD" and the like.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by their moves to introduce the U.S. THAAD, etc.
					
					 Long ago the puppet forces claimed that "low altitude missile shield" of their own style was enough to intercept missiles in the light of the geographical conditions of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 However, they are now scheming to import the U.S. interceptor system fit for intercepting IBMs, not content with trumpeting about the need for "multi interceptor system" from shortly ago.
					
					 THAAD is a high-altitude theater missile defense system, the core of the U.S. MD, as it is aimed to intercept ballistic missiles flying   in outer space. The U.S. forward-deployed this interceptor system on Guam in a bid to put military pressure on the DPRK and China in April last. 
					
					 THAAD is aimed at mounting a preemptive nuclear attack on not only the DPRK but the whole of the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 In the final analysis, the puppet group's introduction of THAAD means acquiring the capability for posing threat to the whole of Asia beyond the peninsula. THAAD will be operated at the instruction of the U.S., its master, as the puppet army has realized the sharing of intelligence with the U.S. forces in the field of ballistic missile tracking and the right to command wartime operations is in the hands of the master.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the puppet regime opened to public its plan to set up a ballistic guided-missile operation control station by next year to interlock it with the U.S. theater missile defense operation control station.
					
					 Facts go to clearly prove that the Park Geun Hye group is fully involved in the U.S. moves to resort to a nuclear threat and blackmail against the region after becoming a shock brigade in carrying out its Asia-Pacific strategy. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group is making eyes at its neighboring countries, talking about "exchange" and "cooperation" and, at the same time, is seriously threatening the security of big powers in the Asia-Pacific region in league with its master behind the scene. It is the root cause of the regional instability.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the Park group cover up the true colors as the arch criminal joining the U.S. in its move to build MD, the one for aggression and domination.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan Large Joint Landing Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan Large Joint Landing Drill
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers announced they would stage a large-scale joint landing drill in the area of Phohang, North Kyongsang Province for 8 days from Nov. 6, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 To be involved there are huge armed forces including at least 10 warships such as landing craft and Aegis destroyer, more than 1 900 marines, armored cars for landing and aircraft belonging to various services.
					
					 It was reported that the Marine Corps would stage a drill for simultaneously attacking the front and the rear, supported by firing from warships and fighter planes during the drill.
					
					 The warmongers are getting more frantic in the drill for a war against the DPRK, openly disclosing their attempt to mount a preemptive attack on it.

articles.title: U.S. Illegal Wiretapping Assailed
articles.content:
U.S. Illegal Wiretapping Assailed
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress in south Korea held a press conference outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Nov. 4 denouncing the U.S. for its illegal wiretapping in many countries of the world.
					 At the press conference speakers said it has been disclosed that the U.S. set up branches for spying in different parts of the world and has operated wiretapping facilities.
					
					 The U.S. wiretapping of even dialogues among heads of state of various countries of the world can never be pardoned as it is espionage from A to Z, they held.
					
					  They urged the U.S. to probe the truth about the wiretapping and dismantle wiretapping facilities in south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Its Moves to Stamp Out Government Employees Trade Union
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Its Moves to Stamp Out Government Employees Trade Union
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The Emergency Situation Council to Denounce IS Interference in Presidential Election for Political Operation in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 5 denouncing the puppet regime for cracking down on the Government Employees Trade Union.
					 Attending it were representatives of the Confederation of Trade Unions and other industrial trade unions, workers, representatives of at least 350 workers, citizens, human rights and public organizations and members of the Government Employees Trade Union.
					
					 At the press conference speakers charged that the Park Geun Hye regime is resorting to moves to stamp out the Government Employees Trade Union in league with conservative organizations in order to divert elsewhere public attention as the truth about the election rigging was exposed by the ceaseless disclosure of power organs' interference in the election.
					
					 The regime is making much fuss, bringing a groundless charge to the Democratic Party that it conducted an illegal election campaign by setting in motion the trade union to support the candidate from the opposition party in an organized way during the last election, they noted.
					
					 They demanded the regime and the "Saenuri Party" stop at once the deceptive actions to get rid of the present situation where the suspects about their election rigging are increasing and discontinue the suppression of the union.
					
					 They urged Park Geun Hye to make an apology for the illegal election and suppression of the union and step down.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Moves to Dissolve Political Party under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Moves to Dissolve Political Party under Fire 
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A campaign is gaining in scope and strength in south Korea to protest against the puppet regime's racket for cracking  down on the opposition Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The puppet regime on Nov. 5 passed the motion calling for judgment aimed at disbanding the UPP through the "State Council meeting" despite strong public opposition. 
					
					 The UPP held an emergency press conference at the plaza of the Seoul City Office on Nov. 5 protesting against the regime's moves to forcibly dissolve the UPP.
					
					 At the press conference speakers termed the suppression of the UPP, a legitimate political party, an illegal and undemocratic act of trampling down the political freedom of the people.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime and the "Saenuri Party" are violating democracy by calling back the departed soul of "yusin" just as Syngman Rhee, Park Chung-Hee, Chun Doo Hwan and Roh Tae Woo did to seize power by fraudulent methods, they held.
					
					 Members of the leadership of the UPP, core members of the Federation of Peasants Associations and the Youth Solidarity and other people held a candlelight rally.
					
					 Kim Jae Yon, lawmaker from the UPP, said the acts of violating law are being committed by Chongwadae and the "Saenuri Party", warning that the suppression of the progressive political party would precipitate the final end of the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 Ro Jong Hyon, member of the Ryonje District Assembly of Pusan from the UPP, declared he could not recognize crafty and incompetent Park as "president" as she took office through election rigging.
					
					 Ri Kwang Sok, chairman of the Federation of Peasants Associations, said that if the UPP should be dissolved for its actions for workers and peasants, the peasants' struggle for vital rights would lead to that for democracy.
					
					 Yun Hui Suk, representative of the Youth Solidarity, questioned whom the regime is trying to judge and dissolve though it is not qualified due to the election rigging, adding that the present regime hostile to the workers and peasants is, indeed, the force seeking rebellion and the target to be disbanded.
					
					 Meanwhile, the emergency joint council of members of the Central Committee of the UPP and chairmen of its regional committees held an emergency meeting at which it declared that the recent tyrannical action spearheaded by Park Geun Hye would not be able to escape a stern judgment by the people.
					
					 A protest campaign continued on Nov. 6, too.
					
					 Lawmakers from the UPP had their hair cut close and launched an indefinite hunger strike.
					
					 Earlier, they held a meeting outside the "National Assembly" building at which they denounced the authorities for making the UPP a target to be dissolved with lies and intrigues.

articles.title: Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace Introduced by British Figure
articles.content:
Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace Introduced by British Figure
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, posted an article introducing the Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace on its website on October 26.
					 Noting that there stands high the palace near Kim Il Sung Square, he introduced its scale in detail. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The palace was built under the warm loving care of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Kim Il Sung made sure that the palace for children, the king of the country, was built on a large scale.
					
					 Visiting this palace only, one can know the difference between the socialist system in the DPRK and the capitalist system.
					
					 Whenever I visit the DPRK, I witness what is quite different from capitalist society familiar to me.
					
					 The palace clearly indicates the big difference between the DPRK's socialist system centered on the popular masses and the unpopular capitalist system.
					
					 A lot of educational, cultural and amusement facilities including the Grand People's Study House, Mansudae Art Theatre and Changjon Street where ordinary people live are for the people.
					
					 Pyongyang is fully demonstrating the socialist advantages of Juche centered on the popular masses.

articles.title: Russian, British Bodies Slam S. Korean Authorities for Suppressing Progressive Party
articles.content:
Russian, British Bodies Slam S. Korean Authorities for Suppressing Progressive Party
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Russian and British bodies strongly condemned the south Korean authorities for their move to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party.
					 The Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia in a statement on Oct. 31 said that the south Korean authorities clearly showed their fascist nature by pressing for the dissolution of the party.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The slightest sympathy with the DPRK is subject to suppression in south Korea.
					
					 The reason for the suppression of the party is that it is opposed to the war moves of the authorities and supports the peace proposal of the DPRK.
					
					 The progressive figures are describing the suppression as "McCarthyism" of the U.S., and the south Korean authorities threw off their mask of "democracy" by resorting to such a vicious action.
					
					 Progressive people are demanding the authorities stop such an action at once.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a joint statement on Oct. 27 described south Korea as a theater of fascist rowdyism and a veritable hell where all activities of the leftwing political parties and the progressive forces desirous of the reunification of the country are banned and progressive idea is brutally suppressed.
					
					 It is quite natural that the south Korean people long for the progressive idea and struggle for independence and reunification, the statement said, urging the authorities to halt such an action and set free all the progressive figures at once.

articles.title: British Organizations Criticize U.S.-S. Korea War Drill
articles.content:
British Organizations Criticize U.S.-S. Korea War Drill
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a joint statement on October 24 in denunciation of a war drill for aggression being staged by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers in south Korea.
					 The war drill indicates that the anti-DPRK moves by the Park Geun Hye group have reached the extremes, the statement said, adding:
					
					 It takes on greater danger as it is under way after south Korea and the U.S. worked out such war scenario as "tailored deterrence strategy", laying bare their attempt to mount a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 Their unabated war exercises for aggression on the DPRK have seriously wrecked peace and security on the Korean Peninsula, pushing the situation to the brink of a war.
					
					 The recent war drill proves the deceptive nature of "peace" touted by the U.S. and the aggressive nature of the U.S. imperialists that remains unchanged.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers should stop at once all the moves for a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The British organizations evinced their determination to advance shoulder to shoulder with the people of socialist Korea centered on the masses which is dignified with Songun.
					
					 They appealed to the world progressives to turn out in the struggle against the DPRK-targeted war exercises of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion sudafricana
articles.content:
South African Government Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The South African government delegation headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Thursday.
					 The members of the delegation visited the old home in Mangyongdae where the President was born and spent his childhood, nurturing his noble intention of revolution. They went round with keen interest historic relics preserved with much care, being briefed on the touching story associated with the historic home.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Mansudae Art Studio, truce village of Panmunjom, Rungna Dophinarium, etc. and enjoyed an acrobatic performance given by the National Circus at the Pyongyang Circus Theater.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con nuevo embajador australiano
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Recognizing Japan's Exercise of "Right to Collective Self-Defense"
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea issued a statement on Thursday condemning the south Korean puppet regime for recently recognizing Japan's exercise of "the right to collective self-defense".
					 Kim Jang Su, chief of the security office of Chongwadae, during his recent visit to the U.S., said that the right to collective self-defense is one of the basic rights of an ordinary state stipulated in the UN Chapter, meaning a tacit support to Japan's exercise of the right.
					
					 Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister of south Korea, uttered at the state inspection of the committee of foreign affairs and unification of the "National Assembly" that some states once recognized Japan's "right to collective self-defense" in accordance with the past San Francisco Treaty, etc. and there was "approach with a great dimension," an undisguised revelation of the intention to allow it.
					
					 The puppet forces are moving to align with Japan in its exercise of the "right to collective self-defense", an unpardonable traitorous act of defending Japan's revival of militarism and paving the way for its overseas aggression. It is also a very dangerous war scheme revealing the attempt at a war of aggression based on the triangular military alliance among the U.S., Japan and south Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Not only Koreans but all other people of the world censure the U.S. recognition of "Japan's exercise of the right to collective self-defense" as "the second Katsura-Taft Treaty".
					
					 It is a dangerous conspiracy for aggression aimed to revive Japan's old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere".
					
					 By siding with Japan's move for the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense", the south Korean puppet forces committed a shameful crime of joining the U.S. and Japan in their scheme for a war of aggression.
					
					 Absolutely intolerable is the traitorous act of the puppet forces unhesitatingly taking part in the war moves against the fellow countrymen while conniving at Japan's thrice-cursed past history of aggression and its moves for grabbing territory.
					
					 The puppet forces are setting preconditions, saying that "agreement" is needed as regards "items related to the sovereignty of the Korean Peninsula" in a bid to cover up their crimes. But it is just a deceptive trick to evade the denunciation of the public at home and abroad.
					
					 Japan's attempt at reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula is becoming a reality and the peace and security of Northeast Asia have been further endangered with the puppet forces' act of colluding with Japan in exercising the "right to collective self-defense".

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre campo de esqui de monte Masik en construccion
articles.content:
National Workshop for Development of Organic Agriculture Sector Held
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A national workshop for the development of organic agriculture sector co-sponsored by the Pyongyang International Information Center for New Technology and Economy and the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movement (IFOAM), took place at the Pyongyang Center for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries from November 5 to 7.
					 Present there were officials of ministries and national institutions and officials and researchers in the field of science, agricultural experts and members of the delegation of the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movement.
					
					 Opening addresses were made at the workshop.
					
					 Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and director of the Pyongyang International Information Center for New Technology and Economy, said that the workshop served as an important occasion in providing a scientific foundation for the development of organic agriculture.
					
					 He stressed that farming methods suited to the actual conditions of the country are being actively introduced into the field of agriculture of the DPRK under the deep concern of the party and the state.
					
					 Andre Frederick Leu, head of the delegation of the IFOAM, referred to the importance of developing organic agriculture which can ensure a high yield.
					
					 He expressed the belief that close cooperation would be effected during the workshop.
					
					  The workshop involved lectures titled "High yield and food security in organic agriculture," etc.
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 The participants in the workshop exchanged successes and experiences gained in the field of organic agriculture.

articles.title: Portavoz de Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal responde a la ACNC
articles.content:
S. Korean Spy Arrested in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Ministry of State Security of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Thursday in connection with an agent of the Intelligence Service of south Korea arrested in the DPRK:
					 A relevant institution recently intercepted an unidentified person in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					
					 At first he insisted that he was Chinese residing in the DPRK and then a citizen of a third country. As investigation progressed, he confessed he is a south Korean who intruded into Pyongyang after illegally entering the DPRK from a third country.
					
					 An initial investigation indicates that he was engaged in anti-DPRK espionage and plot-breeding activities in a third country bordering the DPRK for nearly six years, while disguising himself as a religionist. He entered the DPRK to rally dishonest elements within the boundary of the DPRK and use them for undermining the stability of the social system in the DPRK.
					
					 This fully proves to what extent the puppet group of conservatives has reached in its anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 An institution for state security is now intensifying investigation.
